newsitem.title: UK: Sugar freight features new orders from S.America.
newsitem.headline: Sugar freight features new orders from S.America.

text.p: Buyers placed new orders in the sugar freight market on Tuesday mainly from south American origins, shipbrokers reported.
Dreyfus was seeking 14,250 tonnes min-max bagged sugar from Santos to the Red Sea for 14-20 November.

The company was also looking for 14,000-15,000 tonnes bagged sugar from Buenaventura to Colombo option east Africa for the first half of December, 14,000 tonnes bagged sugar from Antwerp/Hamburg to Algeria and 1,800 tonnes from Rouen/Hamburg to the Turkish Mediterannean for early November, brokers said.

Marubeni quoted 13,000 tonnes bulk sugar from Rosario to the US Gulf or the Atlantic in the second half of November while Booker had 9,000 to 11,000 tonnes bulk from Georgetown Guyana to the UK or Nantes for early November.
Another order came from Czarnikow Rionda for 14,000 to 15,000 tonnes bagged sugar from south Brazil to the Red Sea with an option to east Africa or Karachi for early November.

The only fixture reported on Tuesday was the E.D. & F. Man cargo of 14,000 to 15,000 tonnes bulk sugar from Maceio or Recife to Alegia prompt in the region of $27-27.5. But the reports could not be confirmed.
